job_title: Registered Nurse in Key West, FL
pros: Great hospital, fantastic staff, great benefits
cons: Cafeteria hours. Closes at 1:30 pm; no dinner offered. Trying to manage patient care and getting to the cafeteria by 1:30 can be challenging. Must bring a lunch/dinner just in case you don’t make it by 1:30.

review_title: Just a foot in the door
job_title: Patient Access Specialist in Key West, FL
pros: Learning Experience. Just a foot in the door for better opportunities elsewhere.
Medical/Dental Benefits were the only thing.
cons: Rude staff and no interdepartmental communication. Everyone just complained about each other.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Key West, FL
pros: Friendly coworkers In some of the units
cons: The company does not care about its employees

job_title: Emergency Medical Technician in Key West, FL
pros: Good salad bar in the cafeteria haha
cons: CEO only cares about his own earnings, not about anyone below him. Hospital cuts corners any and every way possible. Is willing to pay triple for travelers but not pay their locals a livable wage.

review_title: small facility, good people, bad (senior) management
job_title: Staff RN PRN in Key West, FL
pros: Coworkers are great, they really care and want to help. The current Med/Surg Director is really trying hard, and gets how hard we work, and how it impacts patient care and experience. I am well compensated, but shifts can be brutal.
cons: Acute care (Med/Surg unit) nurses regularly have 6 patients, which is just not safe. We are not allowed a unit clerk/secretary, and there are no transporters in the building. Current senior leadership just doesn't get it. Hopefully the new director can make a difference.

job_title: ER Tech in Key West, FL
cons: Low pay, understaffed, too small for the population

job_title: Registered Nurse in Key West, FL
pros: This is a great place to gain experience.
cons: I don't have anything negative to say.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Key West, FL
pros: Small hospital, everyone knows each other, friendly peers, plenty of hours.
cons: Upper administration doesn’t care about employees, financially driven rather than quality care/hcaps, low pay in regard to cost of living.

pros: Co-workers dedication to patient care. Close working relationships with the physicians on staff. Living on the island of Key West, and all that island life has to offer.
cons: Chronically understaffed, RN's required to provide excellent nursing care to 7 pt.s staffing with no regard to acuity level of illnesses. Often times with one CNA to 10-15 pt.s. As an RN many times pt. Loads are extremely unsafe, with 1-2 pt.s in full blown DT's, several total cares, and not enough staff to take anyone to the many tests that need to be done. Call lights unanswered due to lack of staff, yet we are instructed to never reveal we are understaffed to pt.s, leaving them to assume a lack of concern for their needs on the part of the staff. Paper charting, as well as computer charting, no unit clerks, sometimes no CNA's too. Charging pt.s for IMC care with the same pt. to nurse ratios as mentioned, no IMC care provided. Improperly functioning equipment. Frozen benefits, mandatory OT, unsafe working environment. Staff concerns falling on deaf ears in management. Punitive responses to expressions of concern. High staff turnover with the exception of those who have small children in school and or home owners with mortgage payments.

pros: Small hospital, great parking, good benefits, decent pay, free coffee and soda, everyone knows everyone, GREAT co-workers, flexibility. Up grades and repairs through out the hospital have been a constant. Opened up a new Cath lab with additional physicians.
cons: Horrible communication! From all levels to all departments, extremely exasperating!   Incompetence seems to be the norm, not the exception. No room for professional advancement. Electricity went out frequently

job_title: RN Case Manager in Key West, FL
pros: The job was very interesting in that the population was very diverse and required different needs.
cons: I felt senior management did not care for their employees as people and there was no interaction or personal feeling toward their staff.

job_title: R N in Key West, FL
pros: Not enough to make a difference.
cons: Extremely poor morale, understaffed, overworked, rules change depending on who is kissing who's butt. There are very good people working here but it seems upper management think since they are the only game in town, they can treat employees in anyway they choose, and they choose badly.

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Key West, FL
pros: schedule flexibility and 401k as a PRN
cons: lack of organization at times with communication and follow through with nursing staff being consistent with treatment and care

job_title: Psychiatric Social Worker in Key West, FL
pros: Excellent professional clinicians. Interesting, varied Patient base
cons: arduous antiquated documentation system in need of modernization.

pros: People you work with are good.
